channel.title: R Projects on Dhara Rawal
channel.description: Recent content in R Projects on Dhara Rawal

item.title: Project 2: Predictive Modelling of Employee Attrition: Analysing Key Factors Influencing Attrition to Develop Targeted Retention Strategies
item.description: Advanced Model Evaluation: Implemented logistic regression, random forests, and support vector machine models for attrition prediction. Conducted rigorous model evaluation using ROC curves and area under the curve (AUC) metrics. Employed nested cross-validation to fine-tune hyperparameters and ensure robust model performance. Interactive Shiny Dashboard: Developed an interactive Shiny dashboard for visualizing predicted attrition in real-time. Integrated dynamic data tables allowing users to filter data by department and explore employees predicted to be in attrition group 1.

item.title: Project 3: Statistical Modelling and Analysis for Alzheimerâ€™s Disease
item.description: Clustering Algorithms: Implemented a variety of clustering algorithms such as K-Means, Hierarchical clustering and KNN. Hierarchical clustering revealed distinct groupings, suggesting potential subgroups within the data Logistic Regression: Conducted logistic regression analysis, exploring associations with Alzheimer’s group. Integrated eTIV into the final model, demonstrating good fit and predictive accuracy. Feature Selection using PCA: Applied principal component analysis to reduce dimensionality. Retained 5 principal components, explaining 90% of the dataset’s variability.

item.title: Project 1: Analysis of Police Use of Force Incidents in Dallas, Texas, USA
item.description: Comprehensive Data Analysis: Conducted a thorough analysis of Police Use of Force incidents in Dallas, Texas, utilizing various data visualization techniques in R to provide a comprehensive understanding of the patterns and trends associated with these incidents. Diverse Visualization Approaches: Employed a range of visualization methods, including traditional plots, interactive plots, and scatter plots, to present the data from multiple perspectives, ensuring a nuanced and insightful exploration of the information.
